definition: similar things come together (idiom); like draws like/Birds of a feather flock together.
thing/object/matter/abbr. for physics 物理
old variant of 以[yi3]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
old variant of 以[yi3]
kind/type/class/category/similar/like/to resemble
to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize
Similar things group together, similar people fit together (idiom); Birds of a feather flock together.
pinyin: wu4 yi3 lei4 ju4 , ren2 yi3 qun2 fen1

sentences.english: Like attracts like , each creature loves his kind.
sentences.chinese: 物以类聚，各种生物都爱他的同类。

sentences.english: In the cosmos, there is a law that like attracts like.
sentences.chinese: 在宇宙中，有个规则叫物以类聚。

sentences.english: You’ll often see a pattern where like attracts like.
sentences.chinese: 你常会看到一种物以类聚的模式。

sentences.english: The saying that "birds of a feather flock together is very true."
sentences.chinese: 有句谚语叫“物以类聚人以群分”是个真理。

sentences.english: B: I’m not surprised. Like attracts like.
sentences.chinese: 我不觉得意外，所谓物以类聚，人以群分。

definition: Similar things group together, similar people fit together (idiom); Birds of a feather flock together.
pinyin: wu4 yi3 lei4 ju4 , ren2 yi3 qun2 fen1

definition: to share vile habits/partners in notoriety/birds of a feather
people who don't belong together, don't get to live together (idiom)/marriages are predestined/people marry because they share common traits
pinyin: bu4 shi4 yi1 jia1 ren2 bu4 jin4 yi1 jia1 men2
related.word: 不是一家人不进一家门

definition: those who handle cinnabar are stained red; those who work with ink are stained black (idiom)/you are the product of your environment
pinyin: jin4 zhu1 zhe3 chi4 , jin4 mo4 zhe3 hei1

definition: lit. persons who walk different paths cannot make plans together/to go separate ways (idiom)
pinyin: dao4 bu4 tong2 bu4 xiang1 wei2 mou2

definition: you can't judge a person by appearance (idiom)/you can't judge a book by its cover/often in combination 人不可貌相，海水不可斗量[ren2 bu4 ke3 mao4 xiang4 , hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2]
when views are irreconcilable, it's a waste of breath to continue discussion (idiom)
pinyin: hua4 bu4 tou2 ji1 ban4 ju4 duo1

definition: see 人不可貌相，海水不可斗量[ren2 bu4 ke3 mao4 xiang4 , hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2]
pinyin: hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2

definition: to be self-interested
you can't judge a person by appearance, just as you can't measure the sea with a pint pot (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 bu4 ke3 mao4 xiang4 , hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2
related.word: 人不可貌相，海水不可斗量

definition: ugly people will do all kinds of weird things to get attention (idiom)
the more friends you have, the more options you have in life (idiom)
pinyin: duo1 ge4 peng2 you3 duo1 tiao2 lu4

definition: lit. heroes usually agree (idiom); Great minds think alike.
pinyin: ying1 xiong2 suo3 jian4 lu:e4 tong2

definition: unable to get along together/incompatible
you should not covet your friend's wife (idiom)
pinyin: peng2 you5 qi1 bu4 ke3 qi1

definition: lit. in the eyes of a lover appears 西施[Xi1 shi1] (idiom); fig. beauty is in the eye of the beholder
pinyin: qing2 ren2 yan3 li3 chu1 Xi1 shi1
